lines.text: I like to think that oysters transcend national barriers.
[after failed recording take of David's guitar]
Don't worry about that. Christ. What would rock and roll be without feedback?
Most people think of us as a very drug oriented group. Of course we're not. You can trust us.

It's like, you give a man a Les Paul guitar and he becomes Eric Clapton, and of course that's not true. And if you give a man an amplifier and a synthesizer, he doesn't become, you know, whoever; he doesn't become us.
I'll have eggs, sausage, chips and beans, and a tea.
I'd like some pie and not the crust!
I... I don't care what bit I get.
All that media stuff is all very irrelevant. If people come to a concert and they don't like it, they don't come again.
We mark a sort of era. We're in danger of becoming a relic of the past. And for some people we represent their childhood of 1967.
Don't tell me it's because they can't scrape the bread together to buy an amplifier. Oh, rubbish.
Rubbish. We only started with about ten bob's worth of gear.
